data.event: By 1937, the mining camp had faded, and all that remained were a blacksmith shop and about 150 cellar holes.
Rowe was established in 1762 and incorporated in 1785, and Charlemont was established in 1742 and incorporated in 1765.

Rowe was established in 1762 and incorporated in 1785, and Charlemont was established in 1742 and incorporated in 1765.
Rowe was established in 1762 and incorporated in 1785, and Charlemont was established in 1742 and incorporated in 1765.
It was in the wooded hills between the two towns that an iron pyrite outcrop was discovered and a mine developed by H.J. Davis around 1882.

event.title: activity because of the profitable operation of Davis Sulfur Ore Mine for twenty-nine years

data.event: The eastern section of Rowe, called Davis, became the center of activity because of the profitable operation of Davis Sulfur Ore Mine for twenty-nine years.
